name: Schoone Oordt Country House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect! Wonderful!
reviews.title: "Wunderbarer Aufenthalt!"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When planning our trip to South Africa (3 weeks along the Garden Route), we saw the amazing pictures of Schoone Oordt by chance. The history of the house, the breathtaking surroundings, the story of Alison and Richard and their hard work over years to create such a place full of love, harmony and indescribable hospitality touched our hearts immediately. We both decided to get married at this wonderful place!
reviews.title: 3 course breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 6 nights (on our trip back to Cape Town we had to stop for another night and it felt like coming home) and experienced a wonderful time! The rooms are very comfortable, the dinners, the breakfasts absolutely flavorful and the services excellent and done hearty.
reviews.title: Stunning rooms, great breakfast in a beautiful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: When thinking back we always have a smile on our faces and warm feelings in our hearts! We will always remember our stay at Schoone Oordt, we hope that we can come back as often as we can to celebrate our anniversary and we want to thank Alison, Sonette, Wander and Emma for making our stay so special!
reviews.title: South African Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arriving we were met by our lovely host Sonette who showed us to our stunning and beautifully decorated room complete with original Victorian bathroom fittings. Unfortunately the kitchen was closed on the night that we stayed there so prospective guests should remember to call in advance if they wish to eat dinner. The breakfast was out of this world and the best we experienced from the 7 different hotels that we stayed in South Africa. The first course involved helping yourself to lovely fresh fruit, cereals and yoghurt accompanied by home made watermelon and orange juice. The second course was baked apple with cinnamon which tasted amazing and then the third course was a mushroom stack with fried egg and tomato which was cooked to perfection, Upon checking out of our room we were allowed to still make use of the pool and relax there for a couple of hours.
reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A beautiful old colonial building with nice clean spacious rooms, clean, spectacular bathroom (open plan shower area, free standing bath, twin washbasins) Equipped with hairdryer, scales, heated rail, toiletries including a bowl of bath salts, dressing gowns, slippers and plenty of towels. The bedroom had an open fire, large comfortable bed, and corner with bar area. The “mini” bar only had large bottles of wine, and no spirits, but selection of soft drinks and beer) Decor was sparse but antique and beautiful. Breakfast was one of the best we had all trip; choice of fresh juices, fresh fruit and yoghurt, eggs Benedict and croissants, all wonderful. Service was fantastic. Shame we couldn’t stay longer as the pool area looked inviting with a decent sized pool with comfy looking sun loungers, discreetly tucked away from view. Note that there are only 2 restaurants in Swellendam, and both were fully booked the night we arrived. We managed to get squeezed in after 9pm.
reviews.title: Quaint stop over with great cuisine and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bit awkward to find, as tucked off the main road on a green, but secure parking found inside. They even cleaned our car without asking or charge, and that just sums up the wonderful service we had throughout our short stay. Would recommend for short stop over on the Garden Route.
reviews.title: Truly amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This guesthouse surpassed my expectations, it was an absolute pleasure to stay here, we were welcomed to the guesthouse by the owner who was most informative about the surrounding area. The room was fantastic, with a comfy king size bed and a fantastically large bathroom with walk in shower, We had afternoon tea overlooking the lawns, it was such a delight. Breakfast was superb, presentation was stunning, the location and outlook of this guest house takes your breath away, During our stay we were looked after by Emma, I would like to say a special thanks to Emma, she was helpful and charming, we wish we could have spent longer here.
reviews.title: First Class!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed for one night en-route from wine country to the Garden Route. The main house and the rooms are superb. The welcome from Alison and her staff was excellent - nothing was too much trouble. A great place to relax and catch your breath for a couple of days, or longer! Can't recommend it highly enough
reviews.title: .. a lasting memory !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had a some what unplanned late arrival due to road work .. but the welcome was warm and understanding with a small drink
reviews.title: 11 out of 10

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: No assistance for the luggage at the arrival, no internet service if you have 2 computers per room, Nobody at the reception desk during the day, the night ... Window cleaner at the bar at 5pm (tea time announced). A waiter once in a while at the restaurant (dinner or breakfast). Poor breakfast if you can not wait for the waiter andif you are in hurry...Minimum 20mn to get the toasts, and eggs, and jam.... and so on ! Dangerous area if you walk even with 4 people on a sunday afternoon ! Nice pool, Nice food at the BBQ.
reviews.title: Disappointing experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: Lovely Victorian building which has been painstakingly restored well situated just off the N2 and perfect to break the journey on the garden route. We had the family suite which was completely adequate for our needs although the decor was nothing special ( except for the original Victorian bath which was huge ) . The family suite is tucked away at the back of the property but has the advantage of also being where Shadow the beautiful resident husky hangs out which pleased the children no end. We had problems with the wifi in our room so went to the main house plus we couldn't get the tv to work but that was minor ( not so however had it been raining). We ate dinner here and the food really was top quality and incredible value but the service was a little slow and forgetful. Breakfast as everyone says is not to be missed. The staff were very helpful and friendly . All in all a perfectly acceptable place to break our journey but nowhere near as memorable as some of the other places we have stayed .
reviews.title: Great place as a stopover but one night was enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We have stayed in Swellendam before and enjoyed it. On returning with friends I found this beautiful old house and we were made thoroughly welcome. The accommodation was excellent with our own sheltered seating area outside. Breakfast was a veritable feast - Wander's reputation being envied by Chefs at other restuarants in the town! We had dinner one of the four nights we stayed and it was excellent. The room was comfortable with the most ithoughtful selection of travellers aids I have ever encountered. The staff were outstanding - especially the lovely Emma. A real treat. Thank you.
reviews.title: A wonderful find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place was just perfect. The rooms are fabulous, so well kitted out. Plus the staff were so friendly and helpful. When we were leaving to travel onto Mossel Bay, the receptionist asked if we were going to drive along the N2 to there, which I was going to do. Thankfully, we were told to take the scenic route in the car and it was wonderful.
reviews.title: Excellent town and excellent guest house

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On top of that kindness, the rooms were brilliant. Everything you could want is in the rooms and there is a great minibar too.
reviews.title: gorgeous escape from reality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have just spent one night at Schoone Oordt (it would have been two but the hotel was fully booked!). Our luxury suite (3) had the most beautiful garden setting. Everything that could possibily be needed was in the room and bathroom. Had the most comfy nights sleep. The 'eye for detail' throughout the country house was amazing. It has to be visited to be appreciated. The food was more than delicious combining the most freshest of ingredients. The staff obviously loved their job and all were more than willing to chat with you but not in a 'pushy' way.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Swellendm is an excellent halfway stopover point along the Garden Route and Schoone Oordt will definitely be a place we will return to.
reviews.title: Wonderful Country House Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely hotel in nice settings. Excellent staff, very friendly and great meals. Rooms a little disappointing tucked into a corner of the garden but nothing to really complain about. Only stayed one night but was a great experience.
reviews.title: Magnificent period property, beautifully refurbished

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Beautiful small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night in the Honeymoon Suite as an overnight stop between Cape Town and the Garden Route.
reviews.title: Lovely place.

aka: Schoone Oordt Country House Hotel Swellendam
description: Schoone Oordt Country House is one of the top boutique hotels in Swellendam with a heartfelt passion for people, for food, for wine and for the environment. Our luxury country hotel offers romantic & intimate as well as family friendly accommodation in Swellendam, South Africa. The emphasis here is on warmth, care, elegance, quality and love and we aspire to make this evident in every aspect of your time with us. We do hope you feel as though you’re visiting with the best of friends.
